Sentencas: In this work, the ability to use the magnetron sputtering deposition technique to synthesize YSZ electrolyte and GDC barrier layer for a solid oxide cell is studied.
Titulo: YSZ/GDC bilayer and gradient barrier layers deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: A particular attention is paid to optimize the YSZ/GDC interface in order to promote adhesion between the layers and the global ionic conductivity.
Titulo: YSZ/GDC bilayer and gradient barrier layers deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: First successive deposition of YSZ and GDC is investigated which leads to the formation of bilayer structure.
Titulo: YSZ/GDC bilayer and gradient barrier layers deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Then co-deposition of both compounds is carried out in order to obtain a chemical composition gradient, ensuring a smooth transition from the electrolyte to the barrier layer.
Titulo: YSZ/GDC bilayer and gradient barrier layers deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The potential use of those deposits in solid oxide cell is evaluated after annealing at 1100 degrees C for 3 h in air.
Titulo: YSZ/GDC bilayer and gradient barrier layers deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Finally, cells with bilayer or gradient deposits are tested at a temperature of 800 degrees C and at a reactive gas flow rate of 24 N mL.min(-1).cm(-2) on the hydrogen side of the cell.
Titulo: YSZ/GDC bilayer and gradient barrier layers deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: A power density of 0.94 W.cm(-2) at 700 mV in SOFC mode and a current density of -1.4 A.cm(-2) at 1.3 V in HTE mode are obtained.
Titulo: YSZ/GDC bilayer and gradient barrier layers deposited by reactive magnetron sputtering for solid oxide cells
